headline: David Perdue Is Scuffling
author: Rich Lowry
sentences:
A key quote from this CNN story:
I'm sure that President Trump still has the expectation that when he endorses someone, they are going to win by 30 points, but we might be moving into a time when that doesn't happen anymore,? said the person close to Perdue.

It may not be a fair test, since dethroning a well-entrenched incumbent governor isn't easy in any circumstance, but the state of David Perdue's Trump-endorsed primary challenge of Brian Kemp suggests that Trump isn't quite the kingmaker people think.

It's very obvious former President Trump has an issue with the governor, but that's not a really compelling reason.?
Kemp, meanwhile, has done nothing to try to play nice with Trump to appeal to his die-hard supporters.

A Trump endorsement doesn't guarantee a runaway victory anymore.?
And the state of play:
David Perdue kicked off his campaign for governor of Georgia with an emphatic endorsement from former President Donald Trump.
In a recent interview with a local radio talk show host, Kemp dismissed a question that Trump's animus could be a factor in his reelection bid.
But since then, his primary challenge to unseat Brian Kemp  the Republican governor Trump loves to hate  has been a big flop.
Very few Republican elected officials, operatives, donors and activists in Georgia have abandoned Kemp in favor of Perdue.
A lot of Republicans don't understand why you would challenge an incumbent Republican governor,? said Tanenblatt.
Perdue, a former US senator, has so far raised a fraction of what Kemp has in his campaign war chest.
I can't worry about a bunch of noise from, you know, people in other states,? Kemp said.
And limited public polling hasn't been promising, either.
